channel.title: Anti Mass... Yer
channel.description:
Well you guys hate Massing? Yes you do... Time to make an AntiMassing system. I have made it on a way... but lets discuss best ways to make it My suggestion is Declare MassTimer as an Public int then in Process add MassTimer-=1; and in an action add if (MassTimer>=1)
Wouldnt that be a good example?
- Edit i was hoping someone was interested in removing massing? -[br][size=1]Posted on: May 06, 2007, 12:15:13 PM[/size][hr]Sorry for double post.. but i think this is a great problem on many servers so why dont you help?

item.title: Anti Mass... Yer
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

I believe there is a variable that holds the amount of time in which the client acts. Check that value and check packet headers and you can reject data as needed?

Read full topic

item.title: Anti Mass... Yer
item.dc:creator: @meanz meanz
item.description:
@meanz wrote:

Well you guys hate Massing? Yes you do…
Time to make an AntiMassing system.
I have made it on a way… but lets discuss best ways to make it
My suggestion is
Declare MassTimer as an Public int then in Process add MassTimer-=1;
and in an action add if (MassTimer>=1)

Wouldnt that be a good example?

  • Edit i was hoping someone was interested in removing massing? -[br][size=1]Posted on: May 06, 2007, 12:15:13 PM[/size][hr]Sorry for double post… but i think this is a great problem on many servers so why dont you help?

Read full topic
